nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: keyInputCol
fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

nodes.name: H2OGLM
nodes.details:
Generalized Linear Models (GLM) estimate regression models for outcomes following exponential distributions. In addition to the Gaussian (i.e. normal) distribution, these include Poisson, binomial, and gamma distributions. Each serves a different purpose, and depending on distribution and link function choice, can be used either for prediction or classification.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/glm.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: isResponseColIsCategorical
fields.description: Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: offset_column
fields.title: Offset Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use as the offset; the value cannot be the same as the value for the weights_column

fields.name: weights_column
fields.title: Weights Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use for the observation weights, which are used for bias correction (The specified weights_column must be included in the specified training_frame)

fields.name: ignore_const_cols
fields.title: Ignore Const Colst
fields.description: Enable to ignore constant training columns

fields.name: ignored_columns
fields.title: Ignored Columns
fields.description: Specify the column or columns to be excluded from the model (Optional, Python and Flow only)

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: NFolds
fields.description: Specify the number of folds for cross-validation

fields.name: fold_column
fields.title: Fold Column
fields.description: Specify the column that contains the cross-validation fold index assignment per observation

fields.name: early_stopping
fields.title: Early Stopping
fields.description: Specify whether to stop early when there is no more relative improvement on the training or validation set

fields.name: remove_collinear_columns
fields.title: Remove Collinear Columns
fields.description: Specify whether to automatically remove collinear columns during model-building

fields.name: max_iterations
fields.title: Max Iterations
fields.description: Specify the number of training iterations

fields.name: interactions
fields.title: Interactions
fields.description: Specify a list of predictor column indices to interact

fields.name: distribution_family
fields.title: Distribution Family
fields.description: Specify the model type

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Specify the random number generator (RNG) seed for algorithm components dependent on randomization

fields.name: alpha
fields.title: Alpha
fields.description: Specify the regularization distribution between L1 and L2

fields.name: compute_p_values
fields.title: Compute P Values
fields.description: Request computation of p-values. Only applicable with no penalty (lambda = 0 and no beta constraints)

fields.name: custom_metric_func
fields.title: Custom Metric Func
fields.description: specify a custom evaluation function (Optional)

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: specifies a probability distribution from an exponential family

fields.name: beta_epsilon
fields.title: Epsilon : Beta Epsilon
fields.description: Specify the beta epsilon value (If the L1 normalization of the current beta change is below this threshold, consider using convergence)

fields.name: gradient_epsilon
fields.title: Epsilon : Gradient Epsilon
fields.description: Specify a threshold for convergence (For L-BFGS only)

fields.name: objective_epsilon
fields.title: Epsilon : Objective Epsilon
fields.description: Specify a threshold for convergence. If the objective value is less than this threshold, the model is converged

fields.name: intercept
fields.title: Intercept
fields.description: Specify whether to include a constant term in the model (This option is enabled by default)

fields.name: family default
fields.title: Link
fields.description: it Specify the model type

fields.name: fold_assignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Specify the cross-validation fold assignment scheme (Applicable only if a value for nfolds is specified and fold_column is not specified)

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_fold_assignment
fields.title: Keep CV Fold Assignment
fields.description: Enable to preserve the cross-validation fold assignment

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_predictions
fields.title: Keep CV Predictions
fields.description: Specify whether to keep the cross-validation predictions

fields.name: lambda
fields.title: Lambda
fields.description: Specify the regularization strength

fields.name: lambda_min_ratio
fields.title: Lambda Min Ratio
fields.description: Specify the minimum lambda to use for lambda search (specified as a ratio of lambda_max, which is the smallest λ for which the solution is all zeros)

fields.name: lambda_search
fields.title: Lambda Search
fields.description: Specify whether to enable lambda search, starting with lambda max (the smallest λ that drives all coefficients to zero)

fields.name: nlambdas
fields.title: Nlambdas
fields.description: Specify the number of lambdas to use in the search (Applicable only if lambda_search is enabled)

fields.name: missing_values_handling
fields.title: Missing Values Handling
fields.description: Specify how to handle missing values (Skip or MeanImputation)

fields.name: non_negative
fields.title: Non Negative
fields.description: Specify whether to force coefficients to have non-negative values

fields.name: solver
fields.title: Solver
fields.description: Specify the solver to use (AUTO, IRLSM, L_BFGS, COORDINATE_DESCENT_NAIVE, COORDINATE_DESCENT, GRADIENT_DESCENT_LH, or GRADIENT_DESCENT_SQERR)

fields.name: standardize
fields.title: Standardize
fields.description: Specify whether to standardize the numeric columns to have a mean of zero and unit variance

fields.name: theta
fields.title: Theta
fields.description: Theta value (equal to 1/r) for use with the negative binomial family, This value must be > 0 and defaults to 1e-10

fields.name: max_active_predictors
fields.title: Max Active Predictors
fields.description: Specify the maximum number of active predictors during computation

fields.name: obj_reg
fields.title: Obj Reg
fields.description: Specify the likelihood divider in objective value computation (This defaults to 1/nobs)

fields.name: prior
fields.title: Prior
fields.description: Specify prior probability for p(y==1), (Use this parameter for logistic regression if the data has been sampled and the mean of response does not reflect reality)

fields.name: score_each_iteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Enable to score during each iteration of the model training (Optional)

fields.name: tweedie_variance_power
fields.title: Tweedie Variance Power
fields.description: Specify the Tweedie variance power (Only applicable if Tweedie is specified for Family)

fields.name: tweedie_link_power
fields.title: Tweedie Link Power
fields.description: Specify the Tweedie link power (Only applicable if Tweedie is specified for Family)
